The microShield userscript is too big to include AdGuard adblocker or AdGuard Extra userscript.
Because I pinned the related message, a reporter can see the message if the reporter reports the issue using AdGuard's anonymous reporting tool.

issue.title: Invalid filter removal request
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer; - [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed; - [X] This is not an ad/bug report. ### Problem description It was infected with adshield and only breakage when I turned on adguard for safari, but I made exceptions to a few filters and it worked normally. So it seems there is a problem with the four domains below.
||html-load.com^$popup
||content-laoder.com^$popup
||css-load.com^$popup
||07c225f3.online^$popup
## User filter
@@||html-load.com^$popup
@@||content-laoder.com^$popup
@@||css-load.com^$popup
@@||07c225f3.online^$popup
## Before applying user filters https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/81290656/f3061f18-bb9d-4454-965d-b7219074face ## after applying user filters https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/81290656/791c7fb3-74e6-4b71-9012-6dfa5fb63846 ### Proposed solution If you remove that pop-up filter, your web pages will no longer breakage.
||html-load.com^$popup
||content-laoder.com^$popup
||css-load.com^$popup
||07c225f3.online^$popup
### Additional information Error Occurrence Conditions After activating adguard, wait 15 to 20 seconds while refreshing the website. Then the web page is breakage.(Only Safari) OS : MAC Browser : safari adblock : adguard for safari

comment.body:
`$popup` modifier does not block any request in a webpage.
It closes a browser tab that the visited URL is matched.

To resolve your issue, please install [microShield](https://community.list-kr.com/docs/AdGuard/Userscripts/microShield).

comment.body:
It seems that content is not loaded without account (after scrolling down there are only blurred images).

You can add these rules to user rules:
```adblock
ebooktops.com#%#//scriptlet('prevent-addEventListener', 'scroll')
ebooktops.com##div[class^="layout___StyledDiv"] > div[class^="overlay___StyledDiv"]
```
but website will be broken.

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.sainsburys.co.uk/gol-ui/favourites-as-list](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sainsburys.co.uk%2Fgol-ui%2Ffavourites-as-list) ### Comment > I updated Adguard to the latest version two days ago - 2.13.0.1558. Since then I cannot access Sainsbury's online grocery shop web page at all unless I disable Adguard. The message I keep getting is Access Denied > > You don't have permission to access "http://www.sainsburys.co.uk/gol-ui/favourites-as-list" on this server. > Reference #18.9d421202.1703928832.4a2b5c2b. However each time the reference number is different. I rely on Sainsburys for my grocery delivery as I am unable to get out much and do not drive. Any idea how to fix this problem. comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Hi Alex-302, 

I'm sorry, I'm not sure I understood your question. 
In the first screenshot - 
https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/1cohejn11ajo8co84kw48woc8osckg4kkl575ngbr4.png, two arrows indicate that the application is enabled. The red rectangles indicate the advertisement being displayed. 
The second - https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ggz8jkods34ssgsgc8w0ccw40owwk442u8r2tsm6k2.png
 shows that the application is turned off and there are no ads. 
I thought that consequence was obvious - ads when enabled AdGuard, and no ads without AdGuard

br, 
Alex

comment.body:
Morning 
I added the custom rule and nothing happened 
I then cleared out ios safari website data for all things meta
Facebook, instagram and and all of their siblings 
Went to m.Facebook.com and your pop up appeared. If I dismiss it safari continues and no adverts are blocked
m.facebook will work for a while and after a few refreshes it will default back to https://facebook.com without requesting desktop version 
Me thinks that facebook has modified its script to defeat ad blockers as I have tried a few other products over the past few days and none of them seem to work 
Maybe having your source in the public domain gives meta an insight on how to defeat blockers 
Regards Jim

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

comment.body:
@lica98 I see that you have `AdGuard for Windows v7.15.0 nightly 31 (4467)` installed.
Currently the latest nightly version is 7.16.0 nightly 17 (4546), but there was a bug in version 7.15.0 nightly 31 and new versions cannot be automatically installed, it's related to this issue - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForWindows/issues/4914

>[!NOTE]
>Once the 7.15.0 nightly 31 (4467) was installed or updated to from the previous one version (if you are using the "nightly" update channel), there is most likely impossible to find out the new updates, unfortunately. We've already found and fixed this bug, but to complete the solution you should install the latest nightly 7.15.0 nightly 31 (4467) manually from the [link](https://agrd.io/windows_nightly). It's not necessarily to clean install - you can install upon the 7.15.0 nightly 31 (4467) of course

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

issue.title: Add some rules for domains starting with an "A"
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?
### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?
### Enter the issue address

Example: #169856 
### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

The normal EasyList Dutch filter list is outdated a lot and in the past they wouldn't approve my new rules as it didn't meet their syntax. But that really hindered me, as some rules need the advanced Adguard/uBlock syntax. 

Below is a list of domains, so you can verify my rules. I have tested them recently (today and max 1 week old):

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?
### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?
### Enter the issue address

Example: #169856 
### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

The normal EasyList Dutch filter list is outdated a lot and in the past they wouldn't approve my new rules as it didn't meet their syntax. But that really hindered me, as some rules need the advanced Adguard/uBlock syntax. 

Below is a list of domains, so you can verify my rules. I have tested them recently (today and max 1 week old):

https://ans-online.nl/

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.
Ad-Shield receives up to 700 000 000 KRW per 2 year from tech foundation support program of South Korean government.

These records can be verified at [here](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+).
You can check the fact that support of South Korean government at [here](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).


## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/166924) if other issue.

comment.body: @CapSel Safari Content Blocker API allows only very basic ad blocking. Advanced Protection injects the content script which apply advanced rules without native support. But even in this case `$$` / `$replace` rules can't be applied.
